Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Effect of Sugammadex on Acute Hypoxic Ventilatory Response Recovery

Trial_Design.evidence: single-center, single-blind, two-experiment randomized controlled trial

Participants.evidence: Healthy volunteers aged 18 years or older were eligible. This study was conducted at Leiden University Medical Center.

Intervention.evidence: compare the effect of 2 and 4 mg/kg sugammadex versus spontaneous recovery

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to compare the effect of 2 and 4 mg/kg sugammadex versus spontaneous recovery on the acute hypoxic ventilatory response (AHVR) after minimal neuromuscular block.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the time to AHVR recovery, measured at baseline, during block, and at 0, 20, and 40 minutes post-recovery.

Result_Outcome.evidence: AHVR was reduced by 32% during block (mean TOF ratio 0.42 ± 0.22). At symptom resolution, AHVR remained 23% below baseline.

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported.
